item.title: Managing Zimbra Accounts with Apache Syncope
item.description: Have you ever thought about centralizing control with Apache Syncope of your Zimbra accounts?

item.title: Adding approval processes on Apache Syncope
item.description: The following post illustrates how you can create a custom approval process on Apache Syncope and use it for approving role requests

item.title: Managing Hippo CMS users with Apache Syncope
item.description: This post describes how to manage Hippo CMS users through Apache Syncope

item.title: Install ConnId Connector Server as a Windows Service
item.description: Java Connector Server is a component that handles Java Connectors bundles. When a Java Connector Bundle is not directly executed into Provisioning System (Apache Syncope), you need to use a remote Java Connector Server.

item.title: Apache Syncope: add user or role pre-processing mechanism
item.description: Before storing/propagating/synchronizing a specific user or role, a pre-processor can be called in order to allow any kind of manipulation before any actual operation takes place.

item.title: How to store user password only on external resources with Apache Syncope
item.description: Today we see how to create a user without saving the password in the Apache Syncope repository. The user password will be stored only on Active Directory.

item.title: Execute adamsync from another host with Apache Syncope
item.description: Execute adamsync from another host with Apache Syncope.

item.title: How to customize Apache Syncope console
item.description: Today, I want to change the color of Apache Syncope console. In particular, I like modify the green background of the console in blue.

item.title: Configure your Test Mail Server for Apache Syncope
item.description: This post will show you how to create a mail server for test Apache Syncope notification.
